comment: Theres something weird about this...i searched secdroid via google play cannot find it, but on google im able to find it. Wth is going on here? Ive never heard of focusedonmobile dev?

title: careful,  this disables wifi dhcp.. uninstalling did not fix, but that tells me it stays secure... fine by me. but maybe for others dev should make a way to disable, also it says it's secure before i grant root,  heh :p...
comment: at least it did for me,  and being on a wifi only setup, i was about to reinstall my system,  but without doing a factory reset,  so all my apps and settings for them would remain, I'd just lose all system tweaks...  isn't root great :D... well now that I'm back with a static IP, I'm going to nandroid backup (just in case) and reinstall my system just in case this outdated system I'm using has been hacked... then install this awesome script to secure my system,  because i need all the extra security...

title: Simple One-Click OS Hardening
comment: Works a charm. Locks down several possible security vulnerabilities. To second another poster, would be great if you could add an option to run at boot automatically! Thanks for your work and for giving the public this free tool! BTW, I got a newer version on XDA Developers I believe.  DEVS: Any way you could add a disable Bluetooth feature? Thanks for all your hard work!!

title: Good...
comment: Breaks Busybox for me, too.  I paid for donation to support this one of a kind developer for this one of a kind app.  I do feel safer using it and reinstalling Busybox isn't particularly difficult.  I just need to find the motivation to take the dev up on his offer to troubleshoot the issue.  Automatic startup options would be nice=)

title: Effective...
comment: but breaks busybox.. Too need to re install busybox to re enable adb.  Edit: Tried latest version and all is working well!

It shouldn't break busy box. Can you please email me so I can get more information. It may be an issue with the particular setup and I may be able to fix it on my end if it's a conflict between my app and your setup.

title: Great app!
comment: For me, it does not break anything.

title: Needs WAY more options
comment: 4 stars because it does what it says, but dev needs to add a clearly visible off switch, because since this app is a root app many users on android may need access to some of these binaries, particularly ssh. This would grant advanced users the best of both worlds when it comes to this app's security features, disabling them when the situation demands it. A checklist for individual binaries to be disabled, and possibly some form of remote disable for lost/stolen devices would make this app more of a must-have for root users.
Thank you for the suggestions I will definitely try to add them in the new update!

title: Pretty neat...
comment: A must have for custom Rom users and even the stock Roms for that matter... 5star's...

title: Security like no other.
comment: It's nice to see a real, intelligent approach to security that doesn't bog down the phone. Actually, I'm beginning to see battery savings.

title: Great Work...
comment: This application does exaction what it sets out to. Even tested the claims and my device is locked down like never before.

title: Unable to chmod
comment: -Unable to chmod  this means you are safe - My device was already secured Thanx to the AOSP power and CM10.1 THUMBS UP

title: Great work.
comment: Most security is locked on to potential intrusions instead of finding the source of attack, this slows device usage and consumes power but this actually protects weak access points of most intrusions. Can't wait for this to be a full release thanks for the work and insight.
